summary: A federal court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Palm Beach School District, commanding its appearance to testify and provide evidence in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena requires a personal appearance on November 29, 2021, at the federal courthouse in Manhattan.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, for which the subpoena is issued to gather evidence.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the subpoena.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Palm Beach School District
events.description: The Palm Beach School District is commanded to appear before the U.S. District Court to testify and provide evidence in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed the Palm Beach School District to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
The subpoena demands a personal appearance on November 29, 2021, at the federal courthouse in Manhattan.
Failure to comply with the subpoena constitutes contempt of court and may result in civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The subpoena was issued by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss on September 16, 2021.
This indicates the prosecution sought evidence or testimony from a local institution in Palm Beach, a location central to the Epstein case.
